meanings.sent1: The clash between the two rival gangs was intense.
meanings.sent2: The clash between the two armies resulted in casualties.
meanings.sent3: The clash over the last piece of cake was settled with a game of rock-paper-scissors.
meanings.sent4: The clash of thunder and lightning echoed through the night sky.
meanings.sent5: The clash of swords in the movie battle scene was thrilling to watch.

meanings.sent1: The clash between the siblings was about who gets to choose the TV show.
meanings.sent2: The clash between the coworkers led to a heated argument.
meanings.sent3: The clash over which flavor of ice cream to get caused laughter at the ice cream shop.
meanings.sent4: The clash of opinions in the meeting made it hard to reach a decision.
meanings.sent5: The clash of personalities in the group project created tension among the team members.

meanings.definition: To collide or come into conflict.
meanings.sent1: The two cars will clash if they both try to park in the same spot.
meanings.sent2: The waves clash against the rocks along the shore.
meanings.sent3: The colors of the two paintings clash in a way that strangely works together.
meanings.sent4: The ideas clash in his mind, making it hard to focus on one solution.
meanings.sent5: The two political candidates clash on various issues during the debate.

meanings.definition: To be incompatible or at odds.
meanings.sent1: His red shirt will clash with the green pants he wants to wear.
meanings.sent2: The loud music from the party clashed with the peaceful atmosphere of the library.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish clash, creating a unique taste that some love and others dislike.
meanings.sent4: Their schedules clash, making it difficult to find a time to meet.
meanings.sent5: The different styles of architecture clash in the city skyline, creating a diverse look.
